link.title: Clayton Public Schools » Home Comments Feed

h3.strong: Beginning tonight, Thursday, April 9th, the lights at Haupt Field will be lit between the hours of 8:20 p.m. and 8:40 p.m. in support of the Class of 2020. The time of 8:20 is symbolic of military time 20:20, and the lights will remain on for 20 minutes.

Beginning tonight, Thursday, April 9th, the lights at Haupt Field will be lit between the hours of 8:20 p.m. and 8:40 p.m. in support of the Class of 2020. The time of 8:20 is symbolic of military time 20:20, and the lights will remain on for 20 minutes.

div.h1: Congratulations to Mr. Jeff Owens for being selected as the High School Educator of the Year!
Congratulations to Ms. Brittany Forgrove for being selected as the Middle School Educator of the Year!
Congratulations to Susan Milillo for being selected as the Elementary School Educator of the Year!

div.p: Create and adopt a long-range facilities plan by June 2020. (Strategic Plan Goal 4)
Clayton School district will promote the physical, social and emotional wellness of students and staff by establishing wellness activities throughout the school year. (Strategic Plan Goal 2)
75% of all teachers will participate in collaboration and articulation activities. (Strategic Plan Goal 1)

b.span: Clayton Public School District will collaborate with parents and the community to provide a safe, caring, and engaging learning environment where all students achieve the New Jersey Student Learning Standards along with the knowledge, skills, and experiences to succeed in a global society.

div.h3: We believe that our mission is to collaborate with parents and the community, to provide a safe, caring, and engaging learning environment where all students achieve the New Jersey Student Learning Standards along with the knowledge, skills, and experiences to succeed in a global society.

At CMS we believe in setting high expectations for student learning, promoting student self-esteem through achievement, and celebrating all students’ successes. Safety and high academic achievement are our first priorities. Teachers and staff provide a family atmosphere where everyone belongs and individual strengths are challenged.

Herma S. Simmons Elementary School offers innovative education programs that align to the New Jersey Student Learning Standards and The Division of Early Childhood Education (DECE) of the New Jersey Department of Education preschool through third grade initiatives. We are dedicated to providing students with a solid educational foundation to prepare them for the academic and social demands of the 21st century.

div.p: Notice is hereby given that the Borough of Clayton Board of Education of the County of Gloucester will be conducting its Regular Meeting on Tuesday, April 28, 2020 at 7 p.m. A public hearing on the 2020-2021 School Budget will be incorporated .

Because the Governor of New Jersey declared a State of Emergency that required the closure of school buildings and offices, the Board of Education shall conduct a virtual meeting on the date listed above, utilizing video conferencing. The virtual board meeting will be live streamed on claytonps.org for members of the public desiring to listen and/or participate in the board of education meeting.
Important matters will be discussed and formal action will be taken.

h3.strong: If you have questions about our Free/Reduced meal programs, please call 856-881-8700 ext. 5500.

h4.strong: New updates on Child Study Team document access can be found on the District Communications and Information Regarding the Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) portion of our website.

ul.li: Students in grades 6-12: please utilize the Student iPad & Technical Support Form here.
All other students: please email cyberschooltechsupport@claytonps.org.
For the latest District communications and information regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19), please visit our dedicated webpage here: https://claytonps.org/coronavirus-updates

div.div:
CPS: NJ Interdistrict Choice School
We are proud to announce that Clayton High School has been selected as a NJ Interdistrict Choice School for grades 9-12. For more information, click on the School Choice link under District Information. We are proud to announce that the Daily Beast (Newsweek Magazine) has ranked Clayton High School as one of the Top High Schools in the nation for 2014!
Find out more →

div.div: Governor Murphy’s Executive Order has declared that all New Jersey public schools to remain closed until further notice. Please see our dedicated Coronavirus (COVID-19) web page for all District communications here.
